meanings.sent1: The bird's warbles filled the forest with sweet melodies.
meanings.sent2: I love listening to the warbles of a talented singer.
meanings.sent3: The warbles of the flute made the baby giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was a cascade of warbles, enchanting all who heard.
meanings.sent5: The warbles of the piano echoed through the room, soothing everyone.

meanings.definition: A swelling or lump on the skin caused by an insect bite
meanings.sent1: The mosquito bite left a red warble on my arm.
meanings.sent2: She applied a cream to reduce the itching of the warble.
meanings.sent3: The warble on his forehead made him look like he had grown a tiny horn.
meanings.sent4: The warble on her ankle throbbed like a tiny drum.
meanings.sent5: The warble on the back of his hand was as round as a marble.

meanings.definition: To sing or whistle with trills or quavers
meanings.sent1: The bird warbles beautifully in the morning.
meanings.sent2: She warbles a lullaby to put the baby to sleep.
meanings.sent3: He warbles like a happy canary when he's in a good mood.
meanings.sent4: The wind warbles through the trees, creating a peaceful melody.
meanings.sent5: The singer warbles with such emotion that it moves the audience to tears.
